name: places/ChIJ48Dfk_tZwokR-g8blgctP58
adrFormatAddress: 25 11th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

originalText.text: Loved the vibe, the space and the food options! This is not your small space food hall... they even had a DJ playing great uplifting music! Loved Mothershuckers - great oysters/clams/crab. Friendly service and clean place too! Also enjoyed Lobster Place - best lobster roll (and only $24, which is a bargain in NYC!), great stuffed oysters and a wonderful salmon/caviar roll. All paired with great wine from the wine bar (towards the back). Wonderful late lunch on a Saturday! We'll be back...

originalText.text: Very impressed with this beautiful waterfront space full of foodie fantasies. Great to learn that the James Beard Foundation has put their seal of approval on each of the vendors. I tried a nice Pinot Gris from Harlem Hops, more of a brew place, but they have excellent bites and mini crab tacos worthy of trying. Grabbed a salmon sashimi served on a crispy rice cake, plus an enormous ("Small 3 pc") portion of spicy fried chicken with a mayo dip from Bousset. Can only call it elevated Asian fare full of memorable but mysterious flavors. Whole place begs for you to eat your way through, really what every food hall should do. Go now. Please.

originalText.text: The food is so good. I love that there’s multiple food options in one place. Definitely a great spot for staying when it’s cold outside. But in warmer weather, there is a rooftop that shows you both New York and New Jersey. It’s beautiful

text.text: The food is so good. I love that there’s multiple food options in one place. Definitely a great spot for staying when it’s cold outside. But in warmer weather, there is a rooftop that shows you both New York and New Jersey. It’s beautiful

originalText.text: Alot of choices for food, I like how they had different foods from different countries/ cultures. I will say, the boba I bought wasn't good and it was pricey, especially for the size. The dosa I got on the other hand was delicious. I got it for $12 from Ammi. It is spicy, so beware if you can't handle spice. There are bathrooms towards the back right. Take the elevator to the top and theres an area where you can see the Statue of Liberty, Little Island, and the buildings of Manhattan.

originalText.text:
Honest review:

Went here on a Monday so it wasn’t as packed as I was expecting. There are a lot of stalls from Mexican to East Asian dishes. There’s also a few that serve dessert.

The prices are definitely expensive for the portion you get. Probably has something to do with the location. The quality and taste of the food are good, but I wish they are more decently priced. We tried 5 stalls and all were a bit pricey. I also wish some stalls would indicate how many pieces you’ll be getting in their menu.

Next, the staff are all nice and friendly! They work at stalls but they serve better than other restaurants (lol). Hope they keep the same level of service.
There are seats with the view of Little Island which is nice.

I’d probably go back one last time to try other stalls (so I could say I tried all of them!), but it’s definitely not a place i’ll frequent.
